prompt_markdown: What are **signals** in Unix? Give examples of common signals and explain what happens when a process receives SIGKILL vs SIGTERM.

criteria.name: definition
criteria.description: Correctly defines signals as async notifications to processes

criteria.name: examples
criteria.description: Lists common signals (SIGINT, SIGTERM, SIGKILL, SIGSEGV)

criteria.name: difference
criteria.description: Explains SIGTERM can be caught/handled, SIGKILL cannot

expected_key_points: signals are software interrupts to processes
SIGTERM can be caught and handled gracefully
SIGKILL cannot be caught, ignored, or blocked
common_mistakes: thinking all signals can be caught
